intro: Mussaenda frondosa var. laxa, commonly known as the softleaf mussaenda, is a deciduous shrub native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its lance-shaped, soft, and hairy leaves that give it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces clusters of small, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in partial shade to full sun and prefers well-drained, moist soil. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and landscapes.
